review: After plugging the device into my TV and the power in, the device started right up and asked me to select the WiFi network. At first, it was unable to connect to my WiFi, but using the HDMI extender cable that comes with it solved that quickly. The initial update was a bit of a pain, seemed to take longer then it should but it wasn't terrible.After the initial setup, things just worked. No problems since. I'm running all the basic apps you'd expect (Netflix, Showtime, etc) and have side-loaded apps with ease from the play store, but the Amazon store more then covers the majority of my needs, even AirPlay. The biggest app I was missing was Dish Anywhere, and now I'm content with my setup (although it works poorly without a touchscreen). There's an Android app called WuKong Remote that worked perfectly with Dish Anywhere. The FireTV Android remote seems to work well, but it's not a full-fledged mouse, and can't interact with Dish's app.The HDMI-CEC capabilities of the device are a nice touch.The only problem that I currently have with the device is how the main interface displays apps. It feels unintuitive and side-loaded apps are only accessible from the settings (unless you use FiredTV launcher or dummy apps). They're not deal-breaker issues, just mild annoyances.Overall, I'm very happy with the FireTV stick, glad I picked one up!
